question: Emma has a flower bed that is 149 meters long. Emma wants to fill her flower bed with plants. Emma's flowers grow 3 inches wide so she needs to leave 7.5 meters between every plant. Emma already owns 14 flowers. Each flowering plant costs $4 at the store, how much money will Emma spend at the store to fill up her flower bed?
answer:
Emma's flower bed is 149 meters / 7.5 meters per plant = <<149/7.5=19>>19 plants needed.
Emma needs to buy 19 plants - 14 plants = <<19-14=5>>5 plants needed to purchase.
Emma will spend 5 plants * $4 = $<<5*4=23>>23.
#### 23
